social_background.tobacco_use: Former smoker (30 pack-year history, quit 5 years ago)
social_background.income: Fixed income with social security, roughly $2,200/month

family_history.father: Deceased at 72, complications related to DM, history of HTN & Obesity
family_history.mother: Deceased at 69, CKD, history of HTN and stroke

past_medical_history: Type II Diabetes Mellitus (DM type II)

health_perception.financial_barriers: Experiences financial strain; avoids routine blood sugar checks to conserve supplies
health_perception.nutritional_barriers: Limited access to nutrient-dense foods due to cost
health_perception.trust_issues: Slight distrust in healthcare system due to past perceived implicit bias

mental_health.self_perception: Extremely frustrated and appears to be 'giving up' due to loss of independence and expressive aphasia
mental_health.coping: ICU admission and stroke have been major stressors
mental_health.value_belief: Frequently references God; requests healing prayers from nurses
mental_health.possible_cognitive_concern: Ex-wife expressed concern over potential confusion

functional_status.current_status: Bedbound due to hemiplegia and fear of movement; often refuses to get up without Hoyer lift even with 2-person assist
functional_status.activity: Requires full assistance with positioning; unable to participate in PT due to weakness and hemiplegia
functional_status.activity_orders: Assist of 2, Hoyer lift; PT Evaluation

er_admission.reason: Admitted to ICU 6 days ago after acute ischemic stroke (left MCA)
er_admission.diagnosis: Left MCA stroke resulting in hemiplegia, dysphagia, mild expressive aphasia

hemoglobin_a1c.interpretation: Value indicates suboptimal control of diabetes (A1C ≥ 7% for known diabetes)

home_medications: Glargine insulin 20 units SC at bedtime
new_medications: Docusate sodium 100mg PO twice a day
Labetalol 10mg IV PRN for systolic BP > 180

objective.diet: Regular, Minced and Moist with Thickened Liquids

nutrition_and_gi.subjective: Extremely dislikes the diet texture; often refuses meals and protein supplements

objective.urinary: Uses bedside urinal with difficulty due to generalized weakness and use of nondominant hand only
objective.bowel: Continent, uses bedpan, at risk for constipation due to immobility

subjective.urinary: States he is continent, had no issues prior to hospitalization
subjective.bowel: States regular bowel movements, denies GI issues
subjective.emotional: Frustrated by lack of independence, embarrassed

eyes.subjective: Hasn't had eye exam in 5 years; concerned about diabetic retinopathy

sleep.pattern: Frequently disrupted in ICU due to alarms and staff

sensory_perception.description: Slightly limited: Responds to verbal commands but cannot always communicate discomfort or need to be turned, OR has some sensory impairment which limits ability to feel pain or discomfort in 1 or 2 extremities.

moisture.description: Moist: Skin is often but not always moist. Linen must be changed at least once a shift.

mobility.description: Very limited: Makes occasional slight changes in body or extremity position but unable to make frequent or significant changes independently.

nutrition.description: Very poor: Never eats a complete meal. Rarely eats more than ⅓ of any food offered. Eats 2 servings or less of protein per day. Takes fluids poorly. Does not take a dietary supplement.

friction_and_shear.description: Problem: Requires moderate to maximum assistance in moving. Frequent sliding, requires repositioning with max assistance. Spasticity or contractures lead to constant friction.

sexuality_reproductive.objective: No recent STI testing on file
sexuality_reproductive.subjective: Not currently sexually active; last STI test 2 years ago, negative

roles_relationships.daughter: Visits when able; works as a nurse with long shifts
roles_relationships.ex_wife: Calls regularly but hasn't visited since ICU admission
